fields.description:
Hi there. I am committing in my _private_ repository as myself, "luke14free" and in the commit history bitbucket shows me as someone called "sontek" (as you can see from the screenshot).

BTW I have no idea who the guy is.
fields.summary: Commit shown as a different user

fields.description:
If I'm not mistaken, there's currently no way to determine whether the authenticated user has write access to a specific repository using the Bitbucket API.

I know it is possible to determine whether it has "admin" access using the "privileges" resource. Similar goes for "read" access. Nonetheless determining if the user has "write" access is not possible without trying to actually write to the repository.

But determining "write"/"admin" access in advance is crucial for any serious application built upon the API.

My proposal is simply adapting following resource: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/privileges+Endpoint#privilegesEndpoint-GETprivilegesforanindividual\\
It is currently restricted to: "only the repository owner, a team account administrator, or an account with administrative rights on the repository can make this call."

Making this resource available to the user that is being queried (so the authenticated user can query this resource about himself for every repository) would solve the whole problematic, providing a clean way of determining the access level to a repository.
fields.summary: Determine whether authenticated user has "write" access to a repository? (BB-9628)

fields.description:
h3. Steps to repro
# Create a new pull request in a private repository
# Type a character in the "Reviewers" field

h3. Expected result
A list of people with access to the private repository (and therefore the contents of the pull request) partially matching the character.

h3. Actual result
A list of _all_ Bitbucket usernames partially matching the character, with some arbitrary ranking that includes people with repository access. Adding any of the other people shows "{person} does not have access to view this pull request" in red error text.
fields.summary: Pull request reviewers typeahead for private repositories shows all Bitbucket users

fields.description:
Please allow me to specify two commits and be presented with a unified diff of all changes between those two commits, for all files that were changed between them, and make comments on this diff. It should look like the ordinary commit review page - nothing special.

I collaborate with a teammate and both of us push to the same repo, but it's a pain to review his work when he pushes a string of work-in-progress commits and I have to figure out in my head what changes did and didn't stick around to the final version.
fields.summary: Allow reviewing of all changes to all files between two commits (BB-9846)

fields.description:
Hi, would be interesting if you could mention a group of users, and they receive notification via email.

Thanks

Ref: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8512/not-send-email-for-team-members-when
fields.summary: Mention a group (BB-9626)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I'm trying to perform the initial push of a brand new git repo to bitbucket (around 180 MB) but I'm not succeeding.

I've already tried bot HTTPS and SSH methods with no luck. The SSH output (the last one I've tried) is:

{code}
#!python
Counting objects: 1709, done.
Compressing objects: 100% (1642/1642), done.
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.iB/s
fatal: sha1 file '<stdout>' write error: Invalid argument
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:bitmakersoftware/arena.git'

{code}

Could you please help me?

Thanks in advance and best regards,\\
Ricardo
fields.summary: Cannot perform initial push

Assigning commit's author by bitbucket username

fields.description:
If you create a Wiki page through the web interface and you put a forward slash '/' on the title (e.g. 'foo/bar') the server spawn a HTTP 500 error. The file is created on the repository (foo/bar.md).

If you create a page called '#foo' bitbucket does create a '#foo.md' on the repository but redirect you to '/wiki/Home#foo'.

I think that URI reserved characters should be URL encoded.
fields.summary: Wiki pages fail to URL-encode certain characters ("#", etc) (BB-9742)

fields.description: In Bitbucket at the moment the version of Git is 1.8.4.2, with the latest release being 1.8.4.3, while Mercurial is 2.2.2, with the latest Mercurial release being 2.8. This is pretty worrying for those of us who use Mercurial with Bitbucket. Does this signify a switch of priorities to Git development, to the detriment of Mercurial, or will there be a "Big Bang" some day where the current version of Mercurial will be fully supported?
fields.summary: Updates on upgrade to new mercurial version

fields.description:

Small enhancement request: On the dashboard (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/issues), in the column "repository", the text in this column is not a link that can be clicked. Only the small icon in front of the repository works as a link that takes you to the repository.\\
This is rather counter-intuitive and a rather small area to hit - even with a mouse.

Suggestion: As with the issue column itself, make the whole cells in 'repository' a link to take the user to the respective repository.

Cheers!

fields.description:
First I tried to update an existing Pull request since I had made two commits to the feature branch, that I wanted to merge into develop. The spinner went on forever so I reload the page and tried again. No luck. Tried the same procedure again without any luck. Then I declined the Pull request and decided to create a new one.

However, the same thing happened when I clicked "Create pull request". The spinner to the left of the button goes on forever and the request is not created. See attached image.
fields.summary: Updating/Creating new Pull request creates dead lock

fields.description:
We use the pull-request flow quite extensively, and it happens that a specific merge has time dependencies on other internal processes. Since we have multiple people authorized to manage pull-requests, it would be nice to have a feature where we can lock a specific pull-request so that accidental merging can be prevented. At the moment we put warnings in the comments, but these get overlooked every now and then.

Locking and unlocking should be nothing but a 'click-barrier', anyone authorized to merge the request should be able to override/unlock.
fields.summary: As repo administrator I want to be able to lock/freeze a pull-request to prevent accidental merging (BB-9607)

fields.description: I wanted create new repository, but when I clicked on the create button I received the error code 500. You can still see it on the url https://bitbucket.org/dudaerich/liresolrindexer
fields.summary: Error 500

fields.description:
For companies it is important that employees use reasonable password management practices. We can advice people on this, but experience shows that most do not take action because better security is always considered a hassle.

When using hosted services like BitBucket, there is no way whatsoever to enforce or review such password management practices.

It would be great if accounts could be configured to:

a) Require two factor authentication (obviously this depends on the two factor issue)\\
b) Require the use of SSH or single-sign-on, so disallowing any access using passwords.

Implementing such security policies would make BitBucket more appealing for commercial companies to use for private repository hosting and can differentiate BitBucket from other options.
fields.summary: Allow accounts to configure authentication requirements for its members (BB-9610)

fields.description: It would be useful to companies if repository listings can be public, but member listings are not. Currently, the public visibility of both is controlled by a single flag 'private profile', so either you're sharing both, or you're sharing neither. It would be great if this can be refined.
fields.summary: Refine private profile feature (BB-9609)

fields.description:
The "html" links for version 2 resources seem to have the hostname {{api.bitbucket.org}} meaning that the link points at a resource that returns {{404 Not found}}.

For example [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/pypy/pypy/pullrequests] shows a pull request whose "html" link points to [https://api.bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/pull-request/191]. Correcting this to [https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/pull-request/191] produces the expected resource.
fields.summary: Version 2 API "html" links point at nonexistent resources (BB-9595)

fields.description:
If you click the source tab when viewing a repository and then click the drop down box to change to browsing a different branch the list of files does not update.  Consequently if there are different files in different branches you get weird results.  Even hitting refresh does not update the list.

The only way I've found to get the correct listing of files to browse is:

* Go to source tab
* Change branch
* Click source tab link again (even though already on that tab)
* Suddenly list of files now updates to match that branch.
fields.summary: File list not updated when switching branches in web source browser

Cheers

fields.description:
The pull request view shows an index of commits included in the request.

The likes badge should display as green with a alt text of "You have approved this commit" for commits that you have approved. It only displays this way if you are the most recent reviewer to have approved a commit.

To recreate:\\
Have another user submit a pull request\\
Visit a commit, approve it, go back to the commits tab of the pull request, see green check-mark badge. Have the author approve the same commit. Refresh the pull request view, see an increased likes count, but with a grey check-mark badge.
fields.summary: Pull Requests: checkmark (likes badge) in commit list does not show green if another user approves a commit after you. (BB-10053)

fields.description: See [BB-9589|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9589]

fields.description:
My username is programmarchy. This is my .ssh/config:

Host bitbucket\\
Hostname bitbucket.org\\
IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa_bitbucket

When I ssh:

bq. ssh -T git@bitbucket.org\\
logged in as peppered.


It logs in as peppered. I created that with donald.ness@gmail.com, the same email address attached to programmarchy. But the peppered account was deleted. It seems like there's a stale email entry for an old user?

Help, because I'm having trouble pushing to my team's repository.
fields.summary: ssh -T logs in to incorrect, previously deleted account

fields.description:
When entering text in the search fields on a page such as:\\
bitbucket.org/site/master/issues

Can you add the logic to dynamically show matching results on-the-fly, In the same way as you can do when searching commits?  such as\\
bitbucket.org/site/master/commits/all
fields.summary: Issues page: Show matching search results On-The-Fly (BB-9588)

fields.description:
Status page says nothing wrong, so here goes.

Initially couldn't push.  Tried browser login to get skull and cross bones with 500 error.

Tried from two other accounts in case this was an account usage issue, corrupt repo or other.

Tried from a second network connection in case this was a location usage issue or something.

An ETA would be amazing.

Thank you.
fields.summary: 500 Something Went Wrong on Login - Multi Accounts - Multi Networks

fields.description:
I just disabled RC4 SSL cipher in my browser because its lack of security.\\
However, cloudfront only supports RC4 which results in "ssl_error_no_cypher_overlap" when loading CSS.

Please fix this as this makes Bitbuckets webfrontend nearly useless.

And no, enabling RC4 again is no option.

Kind regards, Patrick
fields.summary: css through cloudfront not loading

fields.description:
About 1-2 hours ago I have created two repositories. One of them (first) still have "please wait, creating repository", and the second has been created over hour ago.

I guess it's endless loop with the first one.

The repositories that are in endless loop:\\
"FantasyForces"\\
"FxCleaner"

While e.g. "FeyGamesFramework" works fine (created AFTER that two).\\
All created by me as private repositories.
fields.summary: "Creating repository"

fields.description:
Attempting to merge a pull request when someone pushes a commit.

* View the pull request in the web interface
* Commit a change to the branch and push via git
* Click merge on the pull request and attempt to merge and close

The previous commit on the branch is merged, not the latest commit. The branch is thankfully not deleted, but an error message is displayed. The branch then needs to be merged manually using git directly.
fields.summary: Pull request race condition

fields.description: I tried to create a repository (https://bitbucket.org/mtopping/imaestri-cookbooks) but received a 500 error, and any attempt to view the repository from my list was stuck in the repository creation state. I waited about 15 minutes and tried with a new name but the same happened. I am unable to delete either repository via the expected url (https://bitbucket.org/mtopping/imaestri-cookbooks/delete)
fields.summary: Failing to create repositories
